revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

Thank you for providing those details. I understand the spot has changed in size, color, and has been bleeding. To clarify, can you tell me if the shape of this spot is symmetrical or if one half looks different than the other (asymmetry)? Also, does it have any irregular borders, like the edges are blurred or jagged?
One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven. The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
Thank you. Now, can you tell me how wide this spot is? Approximately, can you compare its size to something like a pencil eraser, a dime, or a quarter?
It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
Thank you. You mentioned the spot is growing. Has the spot changed in any other ways recently, like its color, how it feels, or if it bleeds or itches more often?
Yes, the spot has been itching more. Also, sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

Thank you. Based on your description of the changes in the spot, it's important to rule out a serious skin condition like melanoma. Given the changes in size, color, bleeding, and itching, I recommend a biopsy to examine the skin cells. I will refer you to a dermatologist for further evaluation and biopsy.

It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
